answer.body:
We encourage students to focus on 1 CCA given the busy schedule of the JC

curriculum.


However, there are some students in CJC who opt for one of our three 2nd CCAs

such as Rugby, Genesis or Ultimate Frisbee given their keen interest in these

activities.


The 2nd CCAs are less intensive with only 1 CCA practice per week.


Students must maintain their good academic performance in order to continue

with two CCAs throughout their JC course.

questionListItems.title: Can students start a new CCA?

answer.body: Students who have a keen interest in a certain CCA can put up a proposal for a new CCA.  The school will consider taking into consideration number of interested students, teacher deployment and funding considerations.

questionListItems.title: Can I be in CCA that is not offered in school, i.e. an external CCA?

answer.body:
All CJCians are strongly encouraged to have one school-based CCA. CCA is an important platform to build positive relationships, learn important life skills and build a sense of community and belonging in the college.


An exception is made for students who participate at the National level in a CCA not offered by the school.


For such students, their primary CCA would be external

but they would normally opt for one of the 2nd CCAs offered by the school in order to participate in the school's CCA system and benefit from its character and leadership development programme.

questionListItems.title: Will I be given my 1st choice CCA?

answer.body:
In CJC, the college will organise a “CCA Baazar” in Term 1 to enable students to have a better sense of the range of CCAs offered. Some CCAs will organise auditions for students to demonstrate and showcase their skills and talents. 


Thereafter, students will be given the opportunity to submit 4 choices for their CCAs. The College will aim to allocate every student one of their 4 CCA choices with a large number of students offered one of their top 2 or 3 choices.
Every CJCian is expected to have a CCA in CJC as CCAs are an important platform for character and leadership development. CCAs are a key aspect of the holistic education programme in CJC.

questionListItems.title: Is there a minimum attendance rate for CCA?

answer.body:
CJCians are strongly encouraged to maintain regular attendance in their CCAs. Similar to CCA in secondary schools, a minimum of 75% attendance in a CCA throughout the year is expected.


Regular attendance will enable the student to benefit from the CCA‚Äôs skills training, character and leadership development programme If students are not able to attend CCA practices, a valid reason such as a medical certificate must be produced to the CCA teacher in-charge.

CJC has a wide list of 1st CCAs to cater to students' interests and talents.  All CJCians must offer one of the main or 1st CCAs in the college. The majority of students in CJC focus on their main 1st CCA which will have 1-2 weekly practices with annual competitions to sharpen their skills and talents.


A small group of students opt to offer a 2nd CCA (Rugby, Genesis or Ultimate Frisbee) given their keen interest in these areas and as a platform to play the associated sports recreationally or in the case of Genesis, to strengthen their Catholic faith. These 2nd CCAs are less intensive in nature (e.g. one practice per week), and are recreational in nature.
